column1: Now in that same country there lived a large handsome tiger
column4: cruel eyes. One day the tiger said to himself
column5: "I am tired of having no home of my own
column6: —of just living around anywhere! I shall build me a house." Accordingly the tiger searched for a place to build his house. He searched on every hill
column9: and under all the trees. At last he found a place which was just right. It was not too high nor too low
column10: not too near a stream and not too far away from one
column11: not under too thick trees and yet not away from the trees out in the hot sun. The tiger said to himself
column12: "I am going to build my house here. The place is all ready for me for there isn't very much underbrush here." He began at once and finished clearing the place. Then it became daylight and he went away.
